alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 9:11PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern West Feliciana, West Baton Rouge, southwestern St. Helena, southern Pointe Coupee, southwestern East Feliciana, northwestern Iberville and northern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 1000 PM CDT... At 911 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Roads, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, New Roads, Jackson, St. Francisville, Livonia, Maringouin, Slaughter, Fordoche, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Morganza, Erwinville, Ramah, Pride, Brownfields, Lottie and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 131 and 150. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 6 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
